customLabels.name: AfflMappingsDescription
customLabels.label: Map Account record types to the Primary Affiliation fields on Contacts to define how updates to those fields impact Affiliation records and how updates to Affiliation records impact Contact records.

customLabels.name: AfflProgEnrollDeleted
customLabels.label: If an Affiliation is related to only one Program Enrolment and that Program Enrolment is deleted, also delete the Affiliation. If you don't enable this setting, select a Status for Affiliations Not Deleted.

customLabels.name: AttendanceCourseConnectionContactMismatch
customLabels.label: Specify a Course Connection that has the same Contact as you specified for this Attendance Event.

customLabels.name: AutoCreateFieldError
customLabels.label: There's an invalid autocreate relationship setting configured in EDA Settings | Relationships | Autocreation. Delete or edit the invalid setting, then try again.

customLabels.name: BatchJobRunningProblem
customLabels.label: We couldn't run the Apex job.

customLabels.name: BothFieldAndValue
customLabels.label: Set the Filter field, or both the Filter field and Filter value.

customLabels.name: CannotChangeContactAndCourseOffering
customLabels.label: Can't change the Contact or Course Offering on a Course Connection that has associated Term Grades or Attendance Events. If you want a Course Connection with a different Contact or Course Offering, create a new Course Connection.

customLabels.name: CannotDelete
customLabels.label: This record can't be deleted because it has one or more related records associated with it. Delete the associated records first, then delete this record. To determine which records should be deleted first, click the Related tab. If you don't see related records, or if you're unable to delete them, contact your System Administrator for assistance.

customLabels.name: InvalidFilter
customLabels.label: The field entered as the Filter Field isn't valid. Filter Fields can be any standard or custom field on the object this trigger is for, as well as fields on related records. Make sure you use the field's API name, and omit any EDA namespace prefix ("hed__").

customLabels.name: MultipleCourseConnection
customLabels.label: More than one Course Connection is associated with this Contact and this Course Offering. Specify the Course Connection that represents the student's enrolment in this Course Offering for this Term Grade.

customLabels.name: NoContactCOFound
customLabels.label: The Contact and Course Offering are not specified or don't match the Course Connection. Either specify only a Course Connection or both a Contact and a Course Offering, so we can save this record with the correct data.

customLabels.name: NoCourseConnection
customLabels.label: There is no Course Connection associated with this Contact and Course Offering. If this student is enrolled in this Course Offering, create a Course Connection.

customLabels.name: NoDataMatch
customLabels.label: The Contact and Course Offering don't match the Course Connection. Either specify only a Course Connection or both a Contact and a Course Offering, so we can save this record with the correct data.

customLabels.name: NoFieldsPopulated
customLabels.label: Either specify only a Course Connection or both a Contact and a Course Offering.

customLabels.name: OnlyCourseConnectionPopulated
customLabels.label: There is no Contact or Course Offering associated with this Course Connection. Choose a valid Course Connection.

customLabels.name: PreferredEmailMatchMustExist
customLabels.label: We can't find the email specified in Preferred Email. Make sure that you're entering the field label of an existing custom email field.

customLabels.name: PreferredEmailMatchNotNull
customLabels.label: The email field you selected in Preferred Email is blank. Either choose a different Preferred Email, or add a value for that email field.

customLabels.name: PreferredEmailRequiredError
customLabels.label: Select a value for Preferred Email.

customLabels.name: PreferredPhoneMatchMustExist
customLabels.label: We can't find the Phone specified in Preferred Phone. Make sure that you're entering the field label of an existing custom Phone field.

customLabels.name: PreferredPhoneMatchNotNull
customLabels.label: The phone selected for Preferred Phone can't be blank.

customLabels.name: PreferredPhoneRequiredError
customLabels.label: Select a value for Preferred Phone.

customLabels.name: RelationshipsAutoDescription
customLabels.label: Auto-Create settings let you define when a Relationship record is automatically created between a Contact and a Campaign Member, based on a custom lookup field on one of the two objects. For example, a 'Referral' lookup from Campaign Member to Contact could create a 'Referrer' and 'Referee' Relationship between the two Contacts. (Note that this feature is not available for Leads or Campaign Member objects that reference Leads.)

customLabels.name: RelationshipsLookupDescription
customLabels.label: Configure matching relationships so you can understand how a Contact is related to another from either Contact record.

customLabels.name: adapterException
customLabels.label: Invalid call. This function is reserved for Salesforce use.

customLabels.name: addrHhAdmAccountOnly
customLabels.label: Address records can only be associated with Accounts or Contacts.

customLabels.name: addrNotEnabledAccount
customLabels.label: The ability to add multiple addresses is disabled for this Account record type. To enable it, go to EDA Settings, click on Accounts and Contacts, and select the appropriate checkbox next to Account Types with Multi-Addresses Enabled.

customLabels.name: addrNotEnabledContact
customLabels.label: The ability to add multiple addresses is disabled for Contacts. To enable it, go to EDA Settings, click on Accounts and Contacts, then select the Contact Multi-Addresses Enabled checkbox.

customLabels.name: addrSeasonalOverlap
customLabels.label: There's an existing Address record for this Account or Contact with seasonal start and end dates that overlap the seasonal dates for this record. Adjust the seasonal dates so that they don't overlap with the other Address record.

customLabels.name: addrSeasonalPartial
customLabels.label: An address can't have partial Seasonal Start and End Dates. Either enter values for all of the Seasonal Start and End date fields, or leave all of them blank.

customLabels.name: addrSeasonalPartialYear
customLabels.label: An address can't have partial Seasonal Start and End Dates. Either enter values for all of the Seasonal Start and End date fields, or leave all of them blank.

customLabels.name: addrValidParentObjects
customLabels.label: Address records can only be associated with Accounts or Contacts.

customLabels.name: adminAccNameFormatHelpText
customLabels.label: The format for naming Administrative Accounts when they are automatically created.

customLabels.name: affiliationWithSameAccExists
customLabels.label: This Contact already has a Primary Affiliation to the specified Account. Either deselect the Primary setting for the other Affiliation so you can designate this one as Primary, or create this Affiliation without the Primary value.

customLabels.name: afflAccountNoRecordType
customLabels.label: We can't create this Affiliation because the specified Account doesn't have a record type.

customLabels.name: afflAccoutMappingError
customLabels.label: We can't save this record because of an Account record type error in Affiliation Mappings. Ask your administrator to verify that Account Record Types are correctly mapped to Contact Primary Affiliations.

customLabels.name: afflNullPointerError
customLabels.label: The {0} Account record type doesn''t exist. Ask your admin to check record types in Affiliation Mappings.

customLabels.name: afflTypeEnforcedDescription
customLabels.label: Require Accounts specified as a Contact’s Primary Affiliation use a record type. Also ensure that all Account record types are mapped to Primary Affiliation fields on the Contact object. If validation fails, the Affiliation isn’t saved.

customLabels.name: automaticHHNamingHelpText
customLabels.label: Automatically rename Household Accounts when Contacts are added or changed.

customLabels.name: defaultAccountRecordTypeMissingError
customLabels.label: We can’t find the Administrative Account record type in your org. Following installation, use Object Manager to create a new record type named ‘Administrative’ for the Account object.

customLabels.name: duplicateWithHEDAField
customLabels.label: The Filter Field value names a duplicate of a product field. Specify a non-duplicate field. Otherwise, we filter using the value in the product field. If you choose the latter option, acknowledge that you accept this filtering logic by appending {0} after the field name. For example, if the duplicate field is Deceased__c, enter Deceased__c{0} as the Filter Field value.

customLabels.name: exceptionRequiredField
customLabels.label: A blank required field is preventing this record from being saved. The required field could be on this record, or on a record related by a lookup value.

customLabels.name: exceptionValidationRule
customLabels.label: A validation rule is preventing this record from being processed. The validation rule might be on this record, or on a related record that's being updated. VALIDATION MESSAGE:

customLabels.name: fieldWithHEDANamespace
customLabels.label: The Filter Field can't include namespace prefixes such as hed__. Remove the namespace prefix and try again.

customLabels.name: giftProcessingConfigException
customLabels.label: You are trying to access Gift Processing without the required configuration information. Contact your administrator for help.

customLabels.name: hhAccNameFormatHelpText
customLabels.label: The format for naming Household Accounts when they are automatically created.

customLabels.name: invalidContactFieldInAffiliationMapping
customLabels.label: We can't save this record because of an error with the Contact field {1}. Ask your admin to check Affiliation Mappings in EDA Settings and set the value for {0} to the API name of an Account lookup field on the Contact object instead of {1}

customLabels.name: invalidRecordTypeInAffiliationMapping
customLabels.label: We can't save this record because {1} isn't a valid Account record type. Ask your admin to check Affiliation Mappings in EDA Settings and set the value for {0} to the API name of a valid Account record type instead of {1}.

customLabels.name: nestedPlanRequirementPPExp
customLabels.label: Plan Requirements can specify either a Program Plan or a parent Plan Requirement, but not both. If this Plan Requirement is a child of another Plan Requirement, specify a parent Plan Requirement only. If this Plan Requirement is a child of a Program Plan, specify a Program Plan only.

customLabels.name: noAccRecType
customLabels.label: The defined account record type does not exist:

customLabels.name: noAfflMappings
customLabels.label: No Affiliation mappings yet. Click New to create one.

customLabels.name: noAutoCreateSettings
customLabels.label: No Auto-Create Settings have been defined. Use the form below to create a new Auto-Create Setting.

customLabels.name: noRecSettings
customLabels.label: No Reciprocal Settings have been defined. Use the form below to create a new Reciprocal Setting.

customLabels.name: stgAccountRecordTypeHelp
customLabels.label: Only unmapped Account record types are available.

customLabels.name: stgAccountTypesMultiAddressesEnabled
customLabels.label: Enable Multiple Addresses for Account Types

customLabels.name: stgAddHispanicOrLatinoPicklistValue
customLabels.label: Add "Hispanic or Latino" as a picklist value to the Ethnicity field if necessary.

customLabels.name: stgAddNotHispanicOrLatinoPicklistValue
customLabels.label: Add "Not Hispanic or Latino" as a picklist value to the Ethnicity field if necessary.

customLabels.name: stgAffiliationsDeleteModalBody
customLabels.label: This Affiliation mapping maps the {0} Account record type to the {1} field on Contact records. We're just making sure that you want to delete it.

customLabels.name: stgAffiliationsEditModalBody
customLabels.label: Select the Account Record Type to map to the Primary Affiliation field on Contacts. The value of the Account Record Type automatically populates in the Primary Affiliation field.

customLabels.name: stgAffiliationsNewModalBody
customLabels.label: Select the Account Record Type to map to the Primary Affiliation field on Contacts. The value of the Account Record Type automatically populates in the Primary Affiliation field.

customLabels.name: stgAfflDeleteWithAutoEnrollment
customLabels.label: If you delete this Affiliation mapping, when an Affiliation with the {0} Account record type is created for a Contact, a Program Enrolment record is no longer automatically created.

customLabels.name: stgAfflNotInserted
customLabels.label: We can't map this Affiliation because it references a record type that is already referenced by another Affiliation Mapping. If you want to add this mapping so the Affiliation is translated, click Edit to modify the existing mapping. Then, specify the field API name under Contact Primary Affl Field. Do not change the name specified for Account Record Type.

customLabels.name: stgAfflProgEnrollDeleteRelated
customLabels.label: Affiliations Related to Deleted Program Enrolments

customLabels.name: stgAutoCompleteEnterChatterGroupName
customLabels.label: Start typing Chatter Group name to search.

customLabels.name: stgAutoCompleteEnterUserName
customLabels.label: Start typing User name to search.

customLabels.name: stgAutoEnrollmentDeleteModalBody
customLabels.label: This auto-enrolment mapping creates Program Enrolments for Affiliations with the {0} Account record type, {1} Affiliation status, and {2} Affiliation role. If you delete this auto-enrolment mapping, Program Enrolments won't be created for matching Affiliations.

customLabels.name: stgAutoEnrollmentEditModalBody
customLabels.label: Select values that create a Program Enrolment record when an Affiliation is created or updated with these values, and the Affiliation is marked as Primary.

customLabels.name: stgAutoEnrollmentNewModalBody
customLabels.label: Select values that create a Program Enrolment record when an Affiliation is created or updated with these values, and the Affiliation is marked as Primary.

customLabels.name: stgAutoEnrollmentProgramDesc
customLabels.label: When Primary Affiliations are created with the values in these mappings, automatically create Program Enrolments.

customLabels.name: stgBackfillQueuedEmailSent
customLabels.label: The backfill was queued successfully. An email will be sent at the completion of the batch.

customLabels.name: stgBtnEDCTrailheadActionA11y
customLabels.label: Go to the Education Cloud trailmix.

customLabels.name: stgBtnRefreshEthnicityDataA11y
customLabels.label: Update the Race field on Contacts with values from the Ethnicity field. The values Not Hispanic or Latino and Hispanic or Latino aren't copied.

customLabels.name: stgBtnRunCopyA11y
customLabels.label: Update the Extended Description field on Course records to use text from the Description field.

customLabels.name: stgBtnRunCourseConnBackfillA11y
customLabels.label: Update Faculty Course Connections to the Default Faculty Record Type value and remaining Course Connections to the Default Student Record Type value.

customLabels.name: stgCleanupQueuedEmailSent
customLabels.label: The Cleanup was queued successfully. An email will be sent when the batch is completed.

customLabels.name: stgConfirmReadyRunBackfill
customLabels.label: I understand and am ready to run Backfill.

customLabels.name: stgCourseConnBackFillError
customLabels.label: There was an error when starting the backfill.

customLabels.name: stgCourseConnBackFillSuccess
customLabels.label: We're updating Course Connection record types. Check the status of the job under Apex Jobs in Setup.

customLabels.name: stgCourseDataMigrationModalBody
customLabels.label: Copies text from the Description field to the Extended Description field on Course records. Existing Extended Description values won't be overwritten. Update page layouts and other references to the Description field after this update.

customLabels.name: stgCourseDescriptionCopyEmailBody
customLabels.label: The batch Apex job processed {0} batches with {1} failures.

customLabels.name: stgCourseDescriptionCopyEmailSubject
customLabels.label: Course Description Copy Job Completed with a status of:

customLabels.name: stgDuplicateRelationshipsHelp
customLabels.label: Specify whether to prevent more than one Relationship record of the same type between two Contacts.

customLabels.name: stgEDAAppDesc
customLabels.label: Education Data Architecture (EDA) is the foundation of the Education Cloud. Its flexible data architecture is designed to configure Salesforce for education.

customLabels.name: stgEDASettingsHasMovedDesc
customLabels.label: We created a new Education Cloud Settings experience that provides access to EDA Settings, along with many other great resources. Setup steps vary based on your EDA version. Review the documentation for details.

customLabels.name: stgEDCSettingsHealthCheckDescription
customLabels.label: Settings Health Check looks for configuration errors in EDA Settings and Setup. Follow the provided recommendations to fix reported errors.

customLabels.name: stgEnableDebugHelp
customLabels.label: Enable debugging so that Salesforce support can view debug statements for managed packages.

customLabels.name: stgErrorInsufficientAccess
customLabels.label: You can't view this page. Your Salesforce admin can help with that.

customLabels.name: stgErrorInsufficientAccessSaving
customLabels.label: You can't save these settings because you no longer have permission to edit them. Your Salesforce admin can help with that.

customLabels.name: stgErrorInvalidSettings
customLabels.label: We couldn’t save your work. Please refresh the page and try again.

customLabels.name: stgErrorNewAutoEnrollment
customLabels.label: All Account record types that have primary Affiliations already have an auto-enrolment mapping. Go to EDA Settings | Affiliations to first create an Affiliation mapping with the record type you want.

customLabels.name: stgEthnicityRaceBackfillModalBody
customLabels.label: Copies standard and custom picklist values, except Not Hispanic or Latino and Hispanic or Latino, from the Ethnicity field to the Race field on Contacts. Before proceeding, make sure you've disabled any processes that reference Ethnicity and Race fields.

customLabels.name: stgEthnicityRaceBackfillModalTitle
customLabels.label: Update the Race field on Contacts?

customLabels.name: stgEthnicityRaceBackfillSuccessToast
customLabels.label: We're updating the Race field on Contacts. Look for an email when the job is done.

customLabels.name: stgHCAccountModelAdminInactiveFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Account Model, verify the Administrative Account Record Type. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Administrative Account Record Type to a valid, active record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCAccountModelAdminNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Account Model, change the Administrative Account Record Type to a valid, active record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCAccountModelDefaultInactiveFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Account Model, verify the Default Account Model record type. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Default Account Model to a valid, active record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCAccountModelDefaultNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Account Model, change the Default Account Model to a valid, active record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCAccountModelHHInactiveFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Account Model, verify the Household Account Record Type. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Household Account Record Type to a valid, active record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCAccountModelHHNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Account Model, change the Household Account Record Type to a valid, active record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCAccountRecordTypeSettingsUnique
customLabels.label: Unique Administrative and Household Account Record Type Settings.

customLabels.name: stgHCAccountRecordTypesNotUnique
customLabels.label: The Administrative Account and Household Account Record Type settings specify the same record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCAccountRecordTypesNotUniqueFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Account Model, change the Administrative Account Record Type or the Household Account Record Type so that they specify a unique record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCAccountRecordTypesUnique
customLabels.label: The Administrative Account and Household Account Record Type settings specify different record types.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapAccRecordTypeInactiveFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Affiliations, verify the Account Record Type for this Affiliation mapping. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to the Account Record Type for the Account object in Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Affiliation mapping's record type to a valid, active record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapAccRecordTypeNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: The Account Record Type for this Affiliation mapping doesn't exist. In EDA Settings | Affiliations, change the Affiliation mapping to use a valid, active record type for the specified Account.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapAccRecordTypeNotUnique
customLabels.label: The {0} ({1}) record type is mapped to multiple Contact Primary Affiliation fields.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapAccRecordTypeUnique
customLabels.label: The {0} ({1}) record type is mapped to a single Contact Primary Affiliation field.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapAccRecordTypeUniqueFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Affiliations, look in the Account Record Type column for multiple mappings specifying {0} ({1}). Edit those Affiliation mappings so that this record type is mapped to only one Contact Primary Affiliation field.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapAutoEnrollRoleInactiveFix
customLabels.label: The Auto-Enrolment Role {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Program Enrolments, verify the Auto-Enrolment Program Mapping that specifies this Role. If the mapping is correct, go to the Affiliation object's Role field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Auto-Enrolment Role to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapAutoEnrollRoleNotFound
customLabels.label: We can’t find the {0} picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapAutoEnrollRoleNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: The Auto-Enrolment Role isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Program Enrolments, edit the Auto-Enrolment Program Mapping that specifies this Role to a valid, active picklist value for the Role field on the Affiliation object.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapAutoEnrollStatusInactiveFix
customLabels.label: The Auto-Enrolment Status {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Program Enrolments, verify the Auto-Enrolment Program Mapping that specifies this Status. If the mapping is correct, go to the Affiliation object's Status field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Auto-Enrolment Status to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapAutoEnrollStatusNotFound
customLabels.label: We can’t find the {0} picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapAutoEnrollStatusNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: The Auto-Enrolment Status isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Program Enrolments, edit the Auto-Enrolment Program Mapping that specifies this Status to a valid, active picklist value for the Status field on the Affiliation object.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapContPrimaryFieldInvalidFix
customLabels.label: The Primary Affiliation field {0} isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Affiliations, edit the Affiliation mapping to specify a valid lookup field on the Contact object.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapContactPrimaryFieldNotUnique
customLabels.label: The {0} ({1}) field is mapped to multiple Account record types.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapContactPrimaryFieldUnique
customLabels.label: The {0} ({1}) field is mapped to a single Account record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCAfflMapContactPrimaryFieldUniqueFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Affiliations, look in the Primary Affiliation Field on Contact column for multiple mappings specifying {0} ({1}). Edit those mappings so that this field is mapped in only one Affiliation mapping.

customLabels.name: stgHCCourseConEnableFix
customLabels.label: Enable Course Connections, which includes configuring Course Connection record types. In EDA Settings | Course Connections, turn on Course Connection Record Types. Then configure Default Student Record Type and Default Faculty Record Type.

customLabels.name: stgHCCourseConFacultyInactiveFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Course Connections, verify the the Default Faculty Record Type. If {1} ({0}) is correct, go to Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Default Faculty Record Type to a valid, active record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCCourseConFacultyNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Course Connections, change the Default Faculty Record Type to a valid, active record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCCourseConRecordTypesNotUnique
customLabels.label: The Default Faculty Record Type and the Default Active Student Record Type settings specify the same record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCCourseConRecordTypesNotUniqueFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Course Connections, change either the Default Faculty Record Type or the Default Student Record Type so that each specifies a unique record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCCourseConRecordTypesUnique
customLabels.label: Unique Default Faculty Record Type and Default Active Student Record Type Settings

customLabels.name: stgHCCourseConRecordTypesUniqueDesc
customLabels.label: The Default Faculty Record Type and Default Active Student Record Type settings specify different record types.

customLabels.name: stgHCCourseConStudentInactiveFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Course Connections, verify the Default Student Record Type. If {1} ({0}) is correct, go to Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Default Student Record Type to a valid, active record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCCourseConStudentNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Course Connections, change the Default Student Record Type to a valid, active record type.

customLabels.name: stgHCPicklistValueNotFound
customLabels.label: We can’t find the {0} picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelFemaleInactiveFix
customLabels.label: The picklist value for Female in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping for {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Relationships, verify the mapping. If the mapping is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Female value to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelFemaleNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: The picklist value for Female in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Relationships, edit the Female value for this mapping to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelMaleInactiveFix
customLabels.label: The picklist value for Male in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping for {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Relationships, verify the mapping. If the mapping is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Male value to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelMaleNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: The picklist value for Male in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Relationships, edit the Male value for this mapping to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelNameInactiveFix
customLabels.label: The Reciprocal Relationships mapping for {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Relationships, verify the mapping that specifies this Name. If the mapping is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Name value to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelNameNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: The Reciprocal Relationships mapping for {0} isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Relationships, edit the mapping that specifies this Name to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelNameNotUniqueDesc
customLabels.label: Verify the reciprocal setting for {0} ({1}) specified in EDA Settings, on the Reciprocal Settings subtab of the Relationships tab. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Name value to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelNameNotUniqueFix
customLabels.label: In EDA Settings | Relationships, look in the Reciprocal Relationships table for multiple mappings with the Name {0} ({1}). Edit those mappings so that only one mapping uses this Name.

customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelNameUniqueDesc
customLabels.label: The {0} ({1}) picklist value is used in only one reciprocal setting.

customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelNeutralInactiveFix
customLabels.label: The picklist value for Neutral in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping for {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Relationships, verify the mapping. If the mapping is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Neutral value to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCReciprocalRelNeutralNotFoundFix
customLabels.label: The picklist value for Neutral in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Relationships, edit the Neutral value for this mapping to a valid, active picklist value.

customLabels.name: stgHCRecordTypeNotFound
customLabels.label: We can’t find the {0} record type.

customLabels.name: stgHealthCheckDescription
customLabels.label: Settings Health Check checks your EDA Settings for invalid configurations. When complete, use the results to identify and fix any invalid settings.

customLabels.name: stgHealthCheckErrorLastRunDate
customLabels.label: We can't show the last run date because of an error

customLabels.name: stgHealthCheckRunError
customLabels.label: We can't run Settings Health Check because of an error. Try running it again.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAccountModel
customLabels.label: The Account record type used when an Account is automatically created for an independent Contact.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAccoutsDeletedIfChildContactsDeleted
customLabels.label: Delete Accounts with these record types if they have no Contacts.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAddressAccRecType
customLabels.label: Select the Account record types that support multiple addresses.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAdminRecType
customLabels.label: The Account record type used for Administrative Accounts.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflCopyProgramEnrollmentEndDate
customLabels.label: Copy the End Date from Program Enrolment records to new Affiliation records. Otherwise, leave the field blank.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflCopyProgramEnrollmentStartDate
customLabels.label: Copy the Start Date from Program Enrolment records to new Affiliation records. Otherwise, leave the field blank.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflCreateFromProgramEnrollmentInfo
customLabels.label: When a Program Enrolment record is created without an existing Affiliation, create an Affiliation record with the values specified below.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflDeleteProgramEnrollment
customLabels.label: If you choose not to delete Affiliations when deleting their related Program Enrolments, select a status for the Affiliations. To leave the status of these Affiliations as is, select None.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflDeleteProgramEnrollmentInfo
customLabels.label: Specify below how you want Affiliation records for deleted Program Enrolments to be handled. The related Affiliation record can either be deleted, or have its Status updated.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflProgEnrollSetRole
customLabels.label: If selected, set the new Affiliation's role to the value defined in Role for Created Affiliations. Otherwise, leave the Affiliation's role blank.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflProgEnrollSetRoleValue
customLabels.label: Select a role for Affiliations created with Program Enrolments.

customLabels.name: stgHelpAfflProgEnrollSetStatusValue
customLabels.label: Select a status for Affiliations created with Program Enrolments.

customLabels.name: stgHelpContactAddrs
customLabels.label: Allow Contacts to have multiple Address records.

customLabels.name: stgHelpContactPreferredEmail
customLabels.label: Require Contacts to have a Preferred Email.

customLabels.name: stgHelpContactPreferredPhone
customLabels.label: Require Contacts to have a Preferred Phone.

customLabels.name: stgHelpContactPreferredPhoneSync
customLabels.label: Copy the Contact's Preferred Phone to their Phone field.

customLabels.name: stgHelpCopyQueuedEmailSent
customLabels.label: We're updating the Extended Description field. Look for an email when the job is done.

customLabels.name: stgHelpCourseConnBackfillDescription
customLabels.label: Changes Faculty Course Connection records to the Default Faculty Record Type value, and all other Course Connection records to the Default Student Record Type value.

customLabels.name: stgHelpCourseConnectionBackfill
customLabels.label: Before enabling Course Connections for the first time, run this Apex job to update Faculty Course Connection records to the Default Faculty Record Type value. Also updates remaining Course Connections to the Default Student Record Type value.

customLabels.name: stgHelpCoursesDataMigration
customLabels.label: Copies text from the Description field on Course records to the Extended Description field to accommodate longer course descriptions.

customLabels.name: stgHelpCoursesDataMigrationCopiesValues
customLabels.label: This utility copies values from the Course Description field to the Extended Description field. This process may take some time, but you can safely close this page and the process will continue in the background.

customLabels.name: stgHelpCoursesDataMigrationDontOverwrite
customLabels.label: If a Course already has a value for Extended Description, we don't overwrite it.

customLabels.name: stgHelpCoursesDataMigrationUpdatePageLayouts
customLabels.label: After the process is complete, remember to update page layouts and other areas of the application that refer to the Description fields.

customLabels.name: stgHelpDefaultContactLanguageFluency
customLabels.label: The Fluency value set when changing or setting a Contact's Primary Language on a Contact Language record.

customLabels.name: stgHelpDefaultFacultyType
customLabels.label: Select the record type for faculty Course Connections.

customLabels.name: stgHelpDefaultStudentType
customLabels.label: Select the record type for student Course Connections.

customLabels.name: stgHelpEnableCourseConnBeforeBackfill
customLabels.label: You must enable Course Connections before running the Course Connections Backfill.

customLabels.name: stgHelpEnableCourseConnBeforeRecordTypes
customLabels.label: You must enable Course Connections before editing record types.

customLabels.name: stgHelpEnableCourseConnections
customLabels.label: Require that Course Connection records specify whether they're for faculty or students. If you turn on this setting, also set the Default Student Record Type and Default Faculty Record Type.</br></br>Before enabling this setting for the first time, run the Legacy Course Enrolment Data Apex job in System Tools.

customLabels.name: stgHelpEnsureExistContactPreferEmail
customLabels.label: For existing Contacts who haven't specified a Preferred Email or Preferred Phone, the cleanup ensures that one of the Contact's standard or custom email addresses or phone numbers are set as the preferred value.

customLabels.name: stgHelpErrorDisable
customLabels.label: Allow error handling for asynchronous jobs to make it easier to see when scheduled jobs fail.

customLabels.name: stgHelpErrorNotifyOn
customLabels.label: Send error notifications to selected recipients. If you choose Chatter Group or User, also specify a value in Error Notification Recipients.

customLabels.name: stgHelpErrorNotifyTo
customLabels.label: Enter a single user name or Chatter group. Users are notified of errors by email, Chatter groups are notified with a post to the feed.

customLabels.name: stgHelpEthnicityRaceBackfill
customLabels.label: If you used the Ethnicity field before EDA version 1.28, this Apex job updates the Race field on Contacts with a copy of standard and custom values from the Ethnicity field. The values Not Hispanic or Latino and Hispanic or Latino aren't copied.

customLabels.name: stgHelpHouseAdmAccountAddressMgmt
customLabels.label: Enables Address management for Administrative and Household Accounts when selected.

customLabels.name: stgHelpHouseholdRecType
customLabels.label: The Account record type used for Household Accounts.

customLabels.name: stgHelpIfCustomValuesEthnicityCopyRace
customLabels.label: If your org previously added custom picklist values to the Ethnicity field that you want to be available in the Race field, copy those custom picklist values to the Race field.

customLabels.name: stgHelpNestedPlanRequirementPP
customLabels.label: If you have a hierarchy for nested Plan Requirements, specifying that they can have only a Program Plan or only a parent Plan Requirement can help maintain your structure.

customLabels.name: stgHelpOrgAccountAddressMgmt
customLabels.label: Enables Address management for Organisational Accounts when selected.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRelAutoCreatedDup
customLabels.label: Auto-created Relationships are deduplicated by default to prevent duplicate Relationship records from being created between two Contacts. Select "Allow Auto-Created Duplicate Relations" to disable this behaviour and allow multiple Relationships of the same type between two Contacts.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRelReciprocalMethod
customLabels.label: Specify how to populate the Type field on automatically created Reciprocal Relationships. Select List Setting to use the values from the Reciprocal Relationships. Select Value Inversion to invert the Type on the original Relationship record.

customLabels.name: stgHelpRemoveAllPicklistValuesEthnicityExceptHispanicOrLatino
customLabels.label: Remove all picklist values from the Ethnicity field except for "Hispanic or Latino" and "Not Hispanic or Latino." We recommend that you replace each removed value with one of the remaining valid values, rather than deleting them outright from existing records. As of EDA version 1.28, the only valid Ethnicity values are "Not Hispanic or Latino" and "Hispanic or Latino."

customLabels.name: stgHelpSimpleAddrChangeIsUpdate
customLabels.label: For simple address changes to Contacts or Accounts, update existing Address records rather than creating new ones.

customLabels.name: stgHelpStoreErrorsOn
customLabels.label: Log and store errors on the Error object. After this setting is enabled, create a tab for the Error object to view error records.

customLabels.name: stgHelpUpdateReportIfDependenciesEthnicity
customLabels.label: If you had reports or formula fields that referenced the previous values in the Ethnicity field, update them.

customLabels.name: stgLeadConversionAccountNamingDesc
customLabels.label: When Leads are converted, automatically rename Accounts to use the account naming format associated with these selected record types.

customLabels.name: stgPreferredEmailBatchEmailBody
customLabels.label: The batch Apex job processed {0} records with {1} failures.

customLabels.name: stgPreferredEmailBatchEmailSubject
customLabels.label: Preferred Email/Phone Job completed with a status of:

customLabels.name: stgPreferredPhoneEmailModalBody
customLabels.label: Refreshes Preferred Email and Preferred Phone fields for all Contacts as specified by your org's related settings. Before proceeding, make sure you've disabled any processes that reference Preferred Email and Preferred Phone fields.

customLabels.name: stgPreferredPhoneEmailModalTitle
customLabels.label: Update Preferred Email and Phone fields?

customLabels.name: stgPreferredPhoneEmailSuccessToast
customLabels.label: We're updating the Preferred Email and Preferred Phone fields. Look for an email when the job is done.

customLabels.name: stgPreferredPhoneSelection
customLabels.label: Select a field for Preferred Phone to copy the value from when the standard Phone field has no value, or more than one 'Phone' field is defined.

customLabels.name: stgPreferredPhoneSelectionDesc
customLabels.label: The field to use for Preferred Phone when the Phone field is blank, or more than one phone value is defined.

customLabels.name: stgReciprocalRelDeleteModalBody
customLabels.label: This Reciprocal Relationship maps the {0} reciprocal value to the {1} {2}, and {3} reciprocal values. We're just making sure that you want to delete it.

customLabels.name: stgReciprocalRelEditModalBody
customLabels.label: Select the Reciprocal Relationship to edit.

customLabels.name: stgReciprocalRelNewModalBody
customLabels.label: Select the Reciprocal Relationship type to create.

customLabels.name: stgRefreshAdminAcctNameDesc
customLabels.label: Updates all Administrative Account records to use the format in Administrative Account Name Format.</br></br>Warning: Before proceeding, learn about the impact of this setting. Also disable processes that reference Administrative Accounts.

customLabels.name: stgRefreshAdminNamesModalBody
customLabels.label: Refreshes all Administrative Account records to use the format in Administrative Account Name Format. Before proceeding, make sure you've disabled any processes that reference Administrative Accounts.

customLabels.name: stgRefreshAdminNamesSuccessToast
customLabels.label: We're updating Administrative Account names. Look for an email when the job is done.

customLabels.name: stgRefreshHHAcctNameDesc
customLabels.label: Updates all Household Account records to use the format in Household Account Name Format. Also enables Automatically Rename Household Accounts, even if previously disabled. </br></br> Warning: Before proceeding, learn about the impact of this setting. Also disable processes that reference Household Accounts.

customLabels.name: stgRefreshHouseholdNamesModalBody
customLabels.label: Updating refreshes all Household Account records to use the format in Household Account Name Format. Before proceeding, make sure you've disabled any processes that reference Household Accounts.

customLabels.name: stgRefreshHouseholdNamesSuccessToast
customLabels.label: We're updating Household Account names. Look for an email when the job is done.

customLabels.name: stgRunCleanUpA11y
customLabels.label: Update Preferred Email and Phone fields for all Contacts.

customLabels.name: stgRunCleanUpEnableFirstTime
customLabels.label: Updates Preferred Email and Preferred Phone for all Contacts based on your org's related settings. It's a good idea to run this job when you enable Require Preferred Email or Require Preferred Phone for the first time or if you haven't enforced them for a while.

customLabels.name: stgSimpleAddressChangeUpdate
customLabels.label: Update Address Records for Simple Changes

customLabels.name: stgSuccessAdminAccountNameRefresh
customLabels.label: The Administrative Account naming refresh was queued successfully. An email will be sent at the completion of the batch.

customLabels.name: stgSuccessHHAccountNameRefresh
customLabels.label: The Household Account naming refresh was queued successfully. An email will be sent at the completion of the batch.

customLabels.name: timeBlockEndTimeMismatch
customLabels.label: We can't save the Course Offering Schedule because its End Time doesn't match the End Time of its associated Time Block. Either edit the End Time, specify a different Time Block, or don't specify a Time Block.

customLabels.name: timeBlockStartTimeMismatch
customLabels.label: We can't save the Course Offering Schedule because its Start Time doesn't match the Start Time of its associated Time Block. Either edit the Start Time, specify a different Time Block, or don't specify a Time Block.
